tools.name: configuration_view
tools.description: Get the current Kubernetes configuration content as a kubeconfig YAML

parameters.name: minified
parameters.description: Return a minified version of the configuration. If set to true, keeps only the current-context and the relevant pieces of the configuration for that context. If set to false, all contexts, clusters, auth-infos, and users are returned in the configuration. (Optional, default true)

tools.name: events_list
tools.description: List all the Kubernetes events in the current cluster from all namespaces

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional Namespace to retrieve the events from. If not provided, will list events from all namespaces

tools.name: helm_install
tools.description: Install a Helm chart in the current or provided namespace

parameters.name: chart
parameters.description: Chart reference to install (for example: stable/grafana, oci://ghcr.io/nginxinc/charts/nginx-ingress)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Helm release (Optional, random name if not provided)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to install the Helm chart in (Optional, current namespace if not provided)

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Values to pass to the Helm chart (Optional)

tools.name: helm_list
tools.description: List all the Helm releases in the current or provided namespace (or in all namespaces if specified)

parameters.name: all_namespaces
parameters.description: If true, lists all Helm releases in all namespaces ignoring the namespace argument (Optional)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to list Helm releases from (Optional, all namespaces if not provided)

tools.name: helm_uninstall
tools.description: Uninstall a Helm release in the current or provided namespace

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Helm release to uninstall

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to uninstall the Helm release from (Optional, current namespace if not provided)

tools.name: namespaces_list
tools.description: List all the Kubernetes namespaces in the current cluster

tools.name: nodes_log
tools.description: Get logs from a Kubernetes node (kubelet, kube-proxy, or other system logs). This accesses node logs through the Kubernetes API proxy to the kubelet

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the node to get logs from

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: query specifies services(s) or files from which to return logs (required). Example: "kubelet" to fetch kubelet logs, "/<log-file-name>" to fetch a specific log file from the node (e.g., "/var/log/kubelet.log" or "/var/log/kube-proxy.log")

parameters.name: tailLines
parameters.description: Number of lines to retrieve from the end of the logs (Optional, 0 means all logs)

tools.name: nodes_stats_summary
tools.description: Get detailed resource usage statistics from a Kubernetes node via the kubelet's Summary API. Provides comprehensive metrics including CPU, memory, filesystem, and network usage at the node, pod, and container levels. On systems with cgroup v2 and kernel 4.20+, also includes PSI (Pressure Stall Information) metrics that show resource pressure for CPU, memory, and I/O. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/instrumentation/understand-psi-metrics/ for details on PSI metrics

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the node to get stats from

tools.name: nodes_top
tools.description: List the resource consumption (CPU and memory) as recorded by the Kubernetes Metrics Server for the specified Kubernetes Nodes or all nodes in the cluster

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Kubernetes label selector (e.g. 'node-role.kubernetes.io/worker=') to filter nodes by label (Optional, only applicable when name is not provided)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Node to get the resource consumption from (Optional, all Nodes if not provided)

tools.name: pods_delete
tools.description: Delete a Kubernetes Pod in the current or provided namespace with the provided name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod to delete

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to delete the Pod from

tools.name: pods_exec
tools.description: Execute a command in a Kubernetes Pod in the current or provided namespace with the provided name and command

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Command to execute in the Pod container. The first item is the command to be run, and the rest are the arguments to that command. Example: ["ls", "-l", "/tmp"]

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: Name of the Pod container where the command will be executed (Optional)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod where the command will be executed

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the Pod where the command will be executed

tools.name: pods_get
tools.description: Get a Kubernetes Pod in the current or provided namespace with the provided name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to get the Pod from

tools.name: pods_list
tools.description: List all the Kubernetes pods in the current cluster from all namespaces

parameters.name: labelSelector
parameters.description: Optional Kubernetes label selector (e.g. 'app=myapp,env=prod' or 'app in (myapp,yourapp)'), use this option when you want to filter the pods by label

tools.name: pods_list_in_namespace
tools.description: List all the Kubernetes pods in the specified namespace in the current cluster

parameters.name: labelSelector
parameters.description: Optional Kubernetes label selector (e.g. 'app=myapp,env=prod' or 'app in (myapp,yourapp)'), use this option when you want to filter the pods by label

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to list pods from

tools.name: pods_log
tools.description: Get the logs of a Kubernetes Pod in the current or provided namespace with the provided name

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: Name of the Pod container to get the logs from (Optional)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod to get the logs from

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to get the Pod logs from

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Return previous terminated container logs (Optional)

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description: Number of lines to retrieve from the end of the logs (Optional, default: 100)

tools.name: pods_run
tools.description: Run a Kubernetes Pod in the current or provided namespace with the provided container image and optional name

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: Container Image to run in the Pod

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod (Optional, random name if not provided)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to run the Pod in

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: TCP/IP port to expose from the Pod container (Optional, no port exposed if not provided)

tools.name: pods_top
tools.description: List the resource consumption (CPU and memory) as recorded by the Kubernetes Metrics Server for the specified Kubernetes Pods in the all namespaces, the provided namespace, or the current namespace

parameters.name: all_namespaces
parameters.description: If true, list the resource consumption for all Pods in all namespaces. If false, list the resource consumption for Pods in the provided namespace or the current namespace

parameters.name: label_selector
parameters.description: Kubernetes label selector (e.g. 'app=myapp,env=prod' or 'app in (myapp,yourapp)'), use this option when you want to filter the pods by label (Optional, only applicable when name is not provided)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Pod to get the resource consumption from (Optional, all Pods in the namespace if not provided)

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace to get the Pods resource consumption from (Optional, current namespace if not provided and all_namespaces is false)

tools.name: resources_create_or_update
tools.description:
Create or update a Kubernetes resource in the current cluster by providing a YAML or JSON representation of the resource
(common apiVersion and kind include: v1 Pod, v1 Service, v1 Node, apps/v1 Deployment, networking.k8s.io/v1 Ingress)

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: A JSON or YAML containing a representation of the Kubernetes resource. Should include top-level fields such as apiVersion,kind,metadata, and spec

tools.name: resources_delete
tools.description:
Delete a Kubernetes resource in the current cluster by providing its apiVersion, kind, optionally the namespace, and its name
(common apiVersion and kind include: v1 Pod, v1 Service, v1 Node, apps/v1 Deployment, networking.k8s.io/v1 Ingress)

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: apiVersion of the resource (examples of valid apiVersion are: v1, apps/v1, networking.k8s.io/v1)

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: kind of the resource (examples of valid kind are: Pod, Service, Deployment, Ingress)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the resource

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional Namespace to delete the namespaced resource from (ignored in case of cluster scoped resources). If not provided, will delete resource from configured namespace

tools.name: resources_get
tools.description:
Get a Kubernetes resource in the current cluster by providing its apiVersion, kind, optionally the namespace, and its name
(common apiVersion and kind include: v1 Pod, v1 Service, v1 Node, apps/v1 Deployment, networking.k8s.io/v1 Ingress)

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: apiVersion of the resource (examples of valid apiVersion are: v1, apps/v1, networking.k8s.io/v1)

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: kind of the resource (examples of valid kind are: Pod, Service, Deployment, Ingress)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the resource

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional Namespace to retrieve the namespaced resource from (ignored in case of cluster scoped resources). If not provided, will get resource from configured namespace

tools.name: resources_list
tools.description:
List Kubernetes resources and objects in the current cluster by providing their apiVersion and kind and optionally the namespace and label selector
(common apiVersion and kind include: v1 Pod, v1 Service, v1 Node, apps/v1 Deployment, networking.k8s.io/v1 Ingress)

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: apiVersion of the resources (examples of valid apiVersion are: v1, apps/v1, networking.k8s.io/v1)

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: kind of the resources (examples of valid kind are: Pod, Service, Deployment, Ingress)

parameters.name: labelSelector
parameters.description: Optional Kubernetes label selector (e.g. 'app=myapp,env=prod' or 'app in (myapp,yourapp)'), use this option when you want to filter the pods by label

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional Namespace to retrieve the namespaced resources from (ignored in case of cluster scoped resources). If not provided, will list resources from all namespaces

tools.name: resources_scale
tools.description: Get or update the scale of a Kubernetes resource in the current cluster by providing its apiVersion, kind, name, and optionally the namespace. If the scale is set in the tool call, the scale will be updated to that value. Always returns the current scale of the resource

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: apiVersion of the resource (examples of valid apiVersion are apps/v1)

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: kind of the resource (examples of valid kind are: StatefulSet, Deployment)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the resource

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Optional Namespace to get/update the namespaced resource scale from (ignored in case of cluster scoped resources). If not provided, will get/update resource scale from configured namespace

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Optional scale to update the resources scale to. If not provided, will return the current scale of the resource, and not update it
